```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(patchwork)
library(p8105.datasets)
```

```{r}
data("weather_df")
```

```{r}
weather_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = 0.5) +
  #adding labels
  labs(
    x = "Minimum daily temp",
    y = "Maximum daily temp",
    title = "Temperature scatterplot",
    caption = "Data from NOAA",
    color = "Location"
  )
```



## Scales
```{r}
ggp_temp = 
  weather_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = 0.5) +
  #adding labels
  labs(
    x = "Minimum daily temp",
    y = "Maximum daily temp",
    title = "Temperature scatterplot",
    caption = "Data from NOAA",
    color = "Location") +
  #trying to change something on x-axis and x-axis is continuous
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = c(-20,0,25),
    labels = c("-20C","0","25")
  ) +
  #changing color palette
  viridis::scale_color_viridis(
    name = "Location", 
    discrete = TRUE
  )

```


Update Base Plot
```{r}
ggp_temp +
  theme_dark() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom") 

print(ggp_temp)
```


## Adding data in geoms

```{r}
central_park_df =
  weather_df |> 
  filter(name == "CentralPark_NY")


molokai_df =
  weather_df |> 
  filter(name == "Molokai_HI")

#use on dataset for one part of my plot and bring in another dataset
ggplot(data = molokai_df, aes(x = date, y = tmax, color = name)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line(data = central_park_df)

```
